Well, I was stuck too when loading mission, but I solved it by dl very last graphics drivers. Be aware to have your OS up-to-date also, and to let the game update itself.
Now, the game works fine, but I can't properly pilot the plane, and to say it straight, with my average computer, this is a slideshow of english countryside pictures, even at lowest detail level. I was afraid of that, as Oleg Maddox stated that the game was too powerful for any machine, apart from the brand new ones.
I'm going to uninstall it, it's unplayable. I will buy it when it goes budget line, and I have a better computer.

this is what ive done in order to install:

1)Mount the file you've downloaded (flt-ilcd.iso) using daemon tools 

2)Run the installer

3)Youll be asked to provide some kind of a serial code // dont do anything just close the installer

4)go back to flt-ilcd.iso>open it>go to the fairlight folder

5)Run their installer (using admin rights{right click & run as an administrator})

6)Install the game 

7)restart

8)go to C:>Program Files>Il-2 cliffs of dover 

9)Run  launcher.exe (make a shortcut in ur desktop if u want)

10) "Enjoy the game" (Run a dogfight over the sea cuz if u try to fly over terain ur FPS will be reduced bellow 15.....)

Thats what ive done to install it.Everything works fine for me (except the game's bugs which are really annoying)

Eheehe: here i found this one. hope it works. i have same problems as u.

3. Q: I see a black screen when launching the game.
A: You are most likely running an Nvidia card with 266.xx drivers. There's a problem with that particular driver version.
It can be resolved by either rolling back to a previous driver version, such as 257.21, or upgrading to the just-released 270.51.
The issue can also be resolved by manually adjusting one of the driver parameters in the registry. This is for more advanced users. Please modify the registry at your own risk.

Start - Run
regedit
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Contro l\GraphicsDrivers
Edit - New - DWord
Name = TdrDelay 
Value Data = 12

alvarthis, your regedit info is not correct, there is nothing after \graphicsdrivers like "edit", "name" or "Value data", just 3 accessable folders "Additional Model Lists" ""Configuration" and "connectivity". You sure you're pointing to the right files?
